item.title: Southern Pecan Pie II
item.description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a timeless dessert that combines a flaky homemade crust with a luscious, sweet pecan filling. Perfectly golden and beautifully textured, this pie is sure to become a cherished favorite for holidays or any special occasion.
item.dc:creator: author_003
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 90 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 50 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 140 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour
  • 3 tablespoons white sugar
  • ½ teaspoon salt
  • ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
  • 1 egg yolk
  • 3 tablespoons ice water
  • 1 ½ cups pecan halves
  • 3 eggs
  • 1 cup light corn syrup
  • ¾ cup white sugar
  • 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
  • 3 tablespoons milk
  • 3 tablespoons butter, melted
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
  2. Cut in chilled butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
  3. Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
  4. Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
  5. Roll out chilled dough and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
  6. Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
  7. Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
  8. In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
  9. Mix in eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well blended.
  10. Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
  11. Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
  12. Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until the pie is golden brown and the filling is set.
  13. Allow pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling firm up.
